sentences.en: "There’s nothing I can tell you about how [this or] any other incidents were or are handled, " CIA historian David Robarge said.
sentences.cn: “关于[这一或]或任何其他事故是如何处理的，我没有什么可以告诉你的，”中央情报局历史学家大卫·罗巴尔说。

sentences.en: A good historian must have an academic mind.
sentences.cn: 出色的历史学家须有学术头脑.

sentences.en: A judicious historian selects and weighs facts carefully and critically.
sentences.cn: 一位明智的历史学家是十分细心与专业地选择与衡量事实的.

sentences.en: Alexander Solzhenitsyn ( 1918 -- ), Soviet novelist and historian.
sentences.cn: 亚历山大-索尔仁尼琴 ( 1918- ), 苏联小说家,历史学家.

sentences.en: An art historian and collector, he was also a practising architect.
sentences.cn: 他身为艺术历史学家和收藏家，同时也是一名从业建筑师。

sentences.en: He calls himself a historian, but his books are a mere journalism.
sentences.cn: 他自称为历史学家, 但是他的书都是些肤浅的通俗作品.

sentences.en: His liking for footnotes might have suited him to be an historian.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢考据,当个历史学家也挺合适.

sentences.en: His work as a historian brought him into conflict with the political establishment.
sentences.cn: 他是一位历史学家，工作的缘故使他处在了和政界的当权者对立的位置上。

sentences.en: Historian Michael Beschloss debunks a few myths.
sentences.cn: 历史学家迈克尔·贝施洛斯破除了几个不实传言。

sentences.en: I am a historian, and I teach in an American university.
sentences.cn: 我是一位历史学家，在美国一所大学任教。

sentences.en: Ian Morris, a Stanford historian and author of Why the West Rules—For Now, has constructed an "index of development" that takes into account urbanization.
sentences.cn: 伊恩·莫里斯，一个斯坦福大学的历史学家和《西方将主宰多久》的作家，设计了一项考虑到城市化的“发展指数”。

sentences.en: The bookish historian now accepts it, reluctantly and ungraciously enough.
sentences.cn: 钻书本的历史学者现在相当勉强和冷淡地承认了它.

sentences.en: The field of aesthetics presents an especially difficult problem to the historian.
sentences.cn: 美学领域向历史学家提出了一个格外困难的问题。

sentences.en: The historian can only treat conscientious religious belief with the respect it deserves.
sentences.cn: 历史学家只可以用应有的尊敬态度来对待严肃的宗教信仰.

sentences.en: The historian draws a parallel between Washington and Lincoln.
sentences.cn: 这位历史学家将华盛顿和林肯作了比较.

sentences.en: The historian drew a horizontal line on the date to remember it.
sentences.cn: 历史学家在日期上画了一条水平线来记住这天。

sentences.en: The historian searched for primary sources of information about the past.
sentences.cn: 历史学家寻找有关过去的原始资料来源.

sentences.en: The historian Yakut described it picturesquely as a "mother of castles".
sentences.cn: 历史学家雅库特把它形象地描述为“城堡之母”。

sentences.en: TYPICAL USE A judicious historian selects and weighs facts carefully and critically.
sentences.cn: 明智的历史学家以小心翼翼、批判性的态度权衡事实.

sentences.en: What one knows is, in youth, of little moment; they know enough who know how to learn. —Henry Adams, American historian and novelist.
sentences.cn: 一个人年轻时学识多少无关紧要；重要的是懂得如何去学习。 —亨利·亚当斯，美国历史学家及小说家。

sentences.en: When confronted with any evidence, the historian has to establish its reliability.
sentences.cn: 当遇到证据的时候, 历史学家需要确立它的可靠性.
